question: Which examples of carbohydrates exhibit <katex>$\alpha$</katex>-link, (<katex>$\alpha$</katex>-glycosidic link) in their structure?
explanation: Starch consists of Amylose and Amylopectin, both of which contain <katex>$\alpha$</katex>-D-glucose units linked by <katex>$\alpha$</katex>-glycosidic linkages.
